title: verxina_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Russian: "Peak, top, summit"[/tn]
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Halwa Sweet (a racemare known for having no tail except for the very base).

She is a contemporary of [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] and [[Gentildonna (racehorse)|]] and was the latter's fiercest rival in their classic races as she consistently finished second in the Triple Tiara, even almost winning the Shuka Sho, only losing by a nose. Verxina gained fame by being a double winner of the Victoria Mile.

She is the elder sister of [[Cheval Grand (racehorse)|]] and [[Vivlos (racehorse)|]].

title: shark_penis
body:
Male [[shark]] reproductive organ, also known as "claspers".

While called a "[[penis]]" here, the shark's claspers are specially adapted fins which are used to anchor the male shark to a female shark during mating.
Unlike a typical penis, claspers are not involved in the insemination process, lack a urethra, and do not ejaculate.

title: antispiral
body:
The final antagonist in the anime [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]], the being known as 'Anti-Spiral' is the collective mentality of the Anti-Spiral race.

* Visually, Anti-Spiral resembles a black humanoid silhouette, with a white, sketchy outline, large round eyes and a small T-shaped mouth.
* The homeworld of the Anti-Spiral race is located on a separate dimension, whose laws of physics Anti-Spiral is capable of manipulating.
* During the final battle against the Gurren Brigade, Anti-Spiral piloted the [[Grand Zamboa]].

title: kama_(mistake)_(fate)
body:
An Archer-class variant of [[Kama (Fate)|]], who debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order Arcade]] as an exclusive servant.

This variant of Kama is notable for dressing as a [[maid]] in her 2nd Ascension, and for having a unique 3rd Ascension despite her 1st Ascension being nearly identical to her Assassin-class variant on the mobile version. Also unlike her Assassin-class variant, she does not [[aged up|age up]] as she ascends. She is called Kama (Mistake) as she had intended to end up in the mobile game's version of Chaldea, but ended up in the Arcade version of Chaldea instead.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[ReDrop]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Shitaya Noriko]]

h4. External links

* "Type-Moon Wiki: Kama (Mistake)":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Kama_(Mistake)

title: g_(genesis1556)
body:
Artist.

Nickname: "G"

h4. Original characters

* [[Annes (g (genesis1556))|Annes]]: Blue-themed dragon girl with a stoic demeanor, [[one-eyed|one eye]], and often carrying an [[ootachi]]. Has an apparent mutual dislike of Dein.
* [[Arisa (g (genesis1556))|Arisa]]: Yellow-themed dragon girl with two extendable barbed spearlike organs growing from the tip of her tail. Has a lesbian crush on Annes.
* [[Dein (g (genesis1556))|Dein]]: Red-themed dragon girl with a [[muscular female|muscular]] and [[scar|scarred]] physique, often wearing a [[fur-trimmed coat]] and [[smoking]] a [[cigarette]] or [[cigar]]. Has an apparent mutual dislike of Annes.
* [[Karutia (g (genesis1556))|Karutia]]: Green-themed dragon girl who is an old friend of Tsubasa Ryuuji. [[Bisexual]] and often drawn provocatively.
* [[Rara (g (genesis1556))|Rara]]: Dragon girl with whitish-pink hair and a younger appearance than the others. Initially portrayed as having a [[yandere]] crush on Rio.
* [[Leia (g (genesis1556))|Leia]]: Pink-themed dragon girl and the most openly sexual of G's characters, with an incestuous attraction to her brother Rio.
* [[Lily (g (genesis1556))|Lily]]: "Dark" version of Lala with [[dark skin]], [[heterochromia]], and flower [[tattoo]]s.
* [[Lutian (g (genesis1556))|Lutian]]: Icy-blue-themed dragon girl with [[yellow eyes]] and a stern demeanor.
* [[Meldine (g (genesis1556))|Meldine]]: Blue-and-white themed dragon girl starring in "A Boy-Eating Young Woman Has Appeared!!":/pools/16166, where she seduces Shota-kun.
* [[Miguel (g (genesis1556))|Miguel]]: Dragon boy with grey-brown hair and fur covering his arms, sexually assertive, and has an attraction to Rio's gender-bent form.
* [[Mia (g (genesis1556))|Mira]]: Black-themed dragon girl with red eyes, shows little emotion.
* [[Rio (g (genesis1556))|Rio]]: Black-and-white-themed dragon boy, often subject to the advances of G's other dragon girls, frequently caught in the middle of the local cetaceans' brawls, and sometimes gender-bent.
* [[Ryuuga (g (genesis1556))|Ryuuga]]: Black-themed dragon girl with similarities to Dein, possessing a [[muscular female|muscular]] and [[scar|scarred]] physique, often drawn wearing an open coat and [[smoking]]. Unlike Dein, she has [[dark skin]] and prefers to smoke a [[smoking pipe|pipe]].
* [[Shota-kun (g (genesis1556))|Shota-kun]]: A young, brown-themed dragon boy starring in "A Boy-Eating Young Woman Has Appeared!!":/pools/16166, where he is seduced by Meldine.
* [[Tsubasa Ryuuji]]: An [[original]] [[female admiral (kancolle)|]] and star of "Half Dragon Admiral":/pools/9099.

title: mokuren
body:
[i][[Boku no Chikyuu o Mamotte]][/i] character.

Mokuren was one of the alien scientist protagonists, as well as the past life of Alice Sakaguchi. Her distinguishing marks are a forehead symbol similar to a stylized flower with four petals and long blond hair.

title: tamamo_no_mae_(third_ascension)_(fate)
body: [[Tamamo no Mae (fate/extra)|]] in her layered blue kimono that she wears as her Third Ascension outfit in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She now has three [[fox tail]]s that she also gained through ascension. Her animations also change, relying more on magic rather than attacking the enemy directly with her other two Ascensions.

body:
Catchall tag that includes all versions of Tamamo (or specifically the Tamamo nine servants) from the [[Fate (series)|]] series.

The [b]Tamamo nine[/b] were a group of nine [[fox girl]] servants first debuted in [[Fate/Extra]]. They were created after the goddess [[Amaterasu (fate)|]] cut off her nine tails which later gained consciousness of their own.

So far, five [spoiler](four if not counting the "fake" Tamamo)[/spoiler] out of nine Tamamos have made their appearance in the Fate series:
* [[Tamamo no Mae (fate/extra)|]]
* [[Koyanskaya (fate)|]]/Tamamo Vitch
* [[Tamamo Cat (fate)|]]
* [[Tamamo no Mae (JK) (fate)|Tamamo JK]]
* [[Tamamo Aria (fate)|]]

title: chiem_(vtuber)
body:
[[Virtual YouTuber]] and the virtual avatar of artist [[chiem]]. Her emoji is 🤍.

Chiem's overall appearance is designed after a [[fallen angel]]-motif. She has [[grey hair]] and two black 'ear [[feathered wings]]'. Her usual outfit consists of a silver dress, a red [[necktie]] and a black and white [[hairband]]. She wears [[uneven legwear]] and [[boots]] (see post #5579533).

Chiem is a quiet and soft-spoken individual. Usually she keeps her stream as wholesome as possible; however, once a certain 'switch' is flipped, certain changes in her personality can be easily spotted. She keep a calm composure whenever she plays Visual Novels (due to being a hardcore professional of this genre), but fumbles around during FPS or Survival game streams to the point of being entirely helpless.

title: spartan_(destroid)
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[MACROSS]] series. It first appeared in [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV anime series from 1982.

The [b]Centinental/Kransmann MBR-07-Mk II Spartan[/b] [[destroid]] is a main [[battle]] [[robot]] system (mecha) created by the [[U.N. Spacy]] to fight the [[Zentradi]].

This is a heavy armored and armed mecha. It has two launchers with several [[missile]]s for long to mid range attacks, as well as a concealed gun cluster in its torso with a [[flamethrower]], a [[grenade launcher]], a [[machine gun]] and an [[energy cannon]]. 

Besides its ranged weapons the mecha also possess two powerful manipulators (hands) designed to rip through the armor of most Zentradi mecha. It can also be equipped with a heavy [[baton]] for [[giant]] [[maclone]] riot control.

In [[real life]] the Spartan was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.
other_names: デストロイド・スパルタン

title: gnerl
body:
A fictional [[alien]] [[starfighter]] from the [[MACROSS]] series. It first appeared in the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982.

The [b]Fighter Pod[/b] (空戦ポッド, [i]kuusen pod[/i]) is a [[Zentradi]] one-man tactical aerospace attack [[spacecraft]] designed for outer space and atmospheric operations. It is very fast, highly maneuverable and also armed with a triple-barreled energy cannon on its nose and several internal missile bays. 

In the TV show, its official name is obscure. But judging from some Zentradi operator's quote in [[Vrlitwhai Kridanik]]'s spaceship, it's called [b]Gnerl[/b] (ジナール). In Artdink's [[PlayStation 3]] [[ video game]], "”MACROSS 30: Ginga wo Tsunagu Utagoe”,":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macross_30:_The_Voice_that_Connects_the_Galaxy the starfighter is officially called "Gnerl".

In [[real life]] it was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

h4.See also
* "Gnerl Fighter Pod Image":https://macross.fandom.com/wiki/Gnerl?file=Gnerl.gif

title: neidhardt_heidegger
body:
A fictional NPC character from the [[Gundam Battle Operation 2]] online multiplayer [[video game]].

[b]Neidhardt Heidegger[/b] is the grumpy, tall, bald and rude looking manager of the Private Military Union (P.M.U.) Base Camp, and [[Tenda Begin]]'s adoptive father. Neidhardt is responsible for giving the players their mission rewards.

title: tenda_begin
body:
A fictional female underage NPC character from the [[Gundam Battle Operation 2]] online multiplayer [[video game]].

[b]Tenda Begin[/b] was orphaned during an unspecified war and was adopted by [[Neidhardt Heidegger]]. She is in charge of assigning the player's training missions.

title: leona_lucraft
body:
A fictional female NPC character from the [[Gundam Battle Operation 2]] online multiplayer [[video game]].

[b]Leona Lucraft[/b] is an expert [[mobile suit]] mechanic and workaholic that, despite her relatively young age, has an expansive career working with machinery, dating back to when she was a child. She works at the P.M.U. Hangar and is in charge of upgrading the player's [[mecha]].

title: katarina_wenders
body:
A fictional female NPC character from the [[Gundam Battle Operation 2]] online multiplayer [[video game]].

[b]Katarina Wenders[/b] is a provocatively dressed [[blonde hair]]ed woman who runs the Supply Counter.

title: carrie_kadbury
body:
A fictional female NPC character from the [[Gundam Battle Operation 2]] online multiplayer [[video game]].

[b]Carrie Kadbury[/b] is a somewhat shy and modest bespectacled young woman who runs the Mission Counter. She is responsible for assigning pilots missions and helping them get ready to sortie. She also acts as a communications operator for pilots during missions.

title: oldem_koda
body:
A fictional NPC character from the [[Gundam Battle Operation 2]] online multiplayer [[video game]].

[b]Oldem Koda[/b] is a stoic, bespectacled man responsible for assigning players ranks and promotions.

title: stitches
body:
Tag used to describe visible thread-holdings on clothing or ones body, you will often see this on [[stuffed animal|stuffed animals]] and [[zombie|zombies]] too. It has a distinctive train track look or appear as X's going in a line.

Sutures (also known as stitches) are used to hold skin and all other tissues of the human body together, after someone has been injured or went through surgery. This is done with a [[needle]] and preformed by a [[doctor]] or [[nurse]].

Not to be confused with [[stitched]].

h4. See also

* [[Patchwork Skin]]

title: grand_zamboa
body:
* [b]Japanese:[/b]（グランゼボーマ）[Guranzeboma]

A mecha piloted by the [[Antispiral|Anti-Spiral]] during the last episode of [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]]. It was created to battle the [[Tengen Toppa Gurren-Lagann (mecha)|Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]] mecha on even grounds.

* Visually, it resembles a black, skeletal version of Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann.
* On the same way that Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann is a manifestation of [[Spiral Power]], Grand Zamboa is a manifestation of "absolute despair".
* Despite being an Anti-Spiral machine, it is capable of using drills as weapons; however, instead of having spiral grooves, the grooves are straight from the tip of the drill to its base.

body: A transformation that appears in the [[Sonic the Hedgehog 3|Sonic 3]] [[Sonic & Knuckles|& Knuckles]]. It is the Hyper State of [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]], achieved by harnessing the power of the seven Super Emeralds, the enhanced versions of the [[Chaos Emerald]]s.

title: the_noid
body: A mascot for [[Domino's Pizza]] in the 1980s. He was a manifestation of the challenges in Dominos' famous "30 minutes or it's free" delivery policy.

title: domino's_pizza
body:
An American chain of [[pizza]] restaurants founded in 1960. A regular part of its ad campaign is the 30-minute guarantee that started from 1973 to 1993, stating that customers would receive their delivered pizzas within 30 minutes or it was free but ended the practice in 1993 due to many car accidents and deaths caused by Dominos delivery drivers trying to reach their destination quickly.

h4.See also

* [[The Noid]]
* [[Pizza Hut]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: jack_in_the_box_(restaurant)
body: An American fast-food restaurant chain founded February 21, 1951, by Robert O. Peterson in San Diego, California, where it is headquartered. Menu items include a variety of chicken tenders, [[french fries]], [[burger|burgers]], and selections of internationally themed foods such as tacos and egg rolls. Their mascot is [[Jack Box]].

title: the_king_(burger_king)
body:
The mascot of [[Burger King]]. Originally known as "The Burger King", he became just "The King" following the introduction of his most famous iteration in 2004. This iteration appeared in costume form with an oversized full-face grinning mask, often appearing in various unexpected places to offer people Burger King food.

Due to the mask making him fall in the uncanny valley, he may be seen as creepy. As a result, he has been used less since 2011, but still makes appearances every now and again.

title: manuel_noriega
body:
Manuel Antonio Noriega Moreno (February 11, 1934 - May 29, 2017) was a [[panama|Panamanian]] dictator (from 1983 to 1989) and military officer, as well as a former intelligence source for the [[CIA]]. 
His violent leadership and growing involvement in drug-trafficking and money laundering eventually led the [[united_states|American]] goverment to launch an invasion on Panama in 1989 with the objective of capturing him.

body:

body:
Washing a [[car]], [[truck]], or other vehicle by hand. For the facility designed to wash vehicles automatically (with brushes or sprayers), use [[car wash (place)|]].

Washing cars by hand is also frequently used as a means of fund raising, particularly in the US, where volunteers will wash cars in exchange for donations. Some of these car washes may feature women in [[bikini]]s to draw in more people, such car washes are referred to as a bikini car wash.

title: data_east
body:
[b]Data East Corporation[/b] (株式会社データイースト [i]Dēta Īsuto Kabushikigaisha[/i]) also abbreviated as [b]DECO[/b], was a legendary Japanese [[video game]] developer and publisher company active from 1976 to 2003, when it declared bankruptcy. 

Their main headquarters were located in Suginami, Tokyo. The American subsidiary, Data East USA, had been headquartered in San Jose, California.

Data East proved to be one of the more successful and long-lasting companies in the business, surviving the video game crash of 1983 in reasonably good shape and going on to release dozens of games for both arcade and home console systems over the next two decades. Some of their most famous coin-op arcade games from their 80s heyday included [[Metal Clash]], [[Karate Champ]], [[Heavy Barrel]], [[BurgerTime]], [[Dragonninja]], [[Sly Spy]], [[RoboCop]], [[Bump 'n' Jump]], Trio The Punch – Never Forget Me..., [[Karnov]] and [[Atomic Runner Chelnov]]. Karate Champ was the first successful fighting game, due to being one of the most influential to modern fighting game standards. During the late 80s and the 90s they also produced games like [[Midnight Resistance]], [[Crude Buster]], the [[kuhga|Vapor Trail]] trilogy and the [[Joe & Mac: Tatakae Genshijin]] and [[Fighter's History]] series.

Data East also purchased licenses to manufacture and sell arcade games created by other companies. Their most successful licensed games included [[Kid Niki: Radical Ninja]], [[spartan_x|Kung Fu Master]] and [[Vigilante]], all licensed from Irem, and [[Senjou no Ookami]] (Commando), licensed from [[Capcom]]. They had a brief stint as a [[Neo Geo]] arcade licensee in the mid-1990s, starting with [[Spinmaster]].

title: who_is_nijika?_(meme)
body:
A copypasta originating from a comment under the video "Metric - Lost Kitten Nijika (Bocchi the Rock)":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jkAr25tA7SA], a variation on the "If X has a million fans, I am one of them" format focused on [[Ijichi Nijika]]. It goes as follows:

Who is Nijika?
For the blind, she is vision.
For the hungry, she is the chef.
For the thirsty, she is water.
If Nijika thinks, I agree.
If Nijika speaks, I’m listening.
If Nijika has a million fans, I am one of them.
If Nijika has ten fans, I am one of them.
If Nijika has only one fan, that is me.
If Nijika has no fans, I no longer exist.
If the whole world is against Nijika, I am against the whole world.
I will love Nijika until my very last breath.

Variations on post #6764418, the image used in the thumbnail for the video, are common.

title: colt_commando
body:
The Colt Commando (also known with designations [b]XM177[/b] or GAU-5) is an [[united states|American]] 5.56×45mm NATO [[assault rifle]]. It is essentially the shorter variant of the [[M16A1]]. Entered service in 1966, the weapon saw first use during the [[Vietnam War]].

The term CAR-15 originally refers to any Colt-marketed [[AR-15]], but it became associated with this [[military]] variant.

Her male equivalent is [[El Catrin]].

title: vladimir_putin
body:
[b]Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin[/b] ([b]Влади́мир Влади́мирович Пу́тин[/b], b. 7 October 1952)

Current president (2000-2008, 2012- ) and former prime minister (1999-2000, 2008-2012) of the [[Russia|Russian Federation]] and former [[Soviet]] [[KGB]] agent.

A controversial figure, he has initially developed a cult following in [[Japan]], who often depict him as "the manliest and most unstoppable leader on earth". This has reached the point that there is a [[comic|manga]] based of his public image as well as an annual calendar of him being sold in Japan. Though his memetic status has been significantly subsided after he ordered [[russo-ukrainian_war|the invasion of Ukraine in 2022]].

h1. See also
* [[Tag group:People]]

title: nabe
body:
Any of a number of communally shared Japanese dishes cooked in a clay or iron hot pot, right at the table.  Diners dip in the components they wish into the shared broth and then retrieve them when they are cooked to taste.  Nabe is frequently served with a dipping sauce ([i]tare[/i]).

h4.  Common types of nabe

* [[Oden]] - A mix of [[hardboiled egg]]s, [[fish cake]], [[daikon]] radish, [[konnyaku_(food)|konnyaku]], and other ingredients.
* [[Sukiyaki]] - A mix of thinly-sliced beef, [[spring onion]], [[tofu]], [[mushroom]], leafy green vegetables, and noodles.

h4.  See also

* [[Hotpot]]
* [[Neko nabe]]
* [[Tag group:Food tags]]

title: zas_m76_(dancer_of_the_night)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[Zas M76 (girls' frontline)|]]'s first skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the game's fourth anniversary 'Soiree Sonata' skin collection in 2020.

Zas M76 switches out her usual beret for a smaller [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]] with a red-and-white [[hat ornament]], allowing her to add two [[hair flower]]s and [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]] for the occasion. Her formal attire consists of a [[black dress|black]]-[[gradient dress|to]]-[[red dress|red]] [[asymmetrical dress]], leaving the left side of her body slightly more exposed, with only a [[black bandeau|black]] [[bandeau]] keeping her covered. Around her waist, the black of the dress transitions briefly into stark red by way of the [[Yugoslavian flag]] and [[olive branch]] dress ornament, connecting into its [[red sash|red]] [[sash]].  Paired with the dress is a small [[black scarf|black]] [[scarf]], [[black gloves|black]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[thigh boots]], with a discrete knife [[sheath]] hidden near their top, with [[red ribbon]]s trailing to the ground. With her, she has a filled [[wine glass]], and a [[weapon case]] upon which the Serbian [[coat of arms]] are emblazoned. Both are discarded in favor of her namesake rifle when damaged.

title: imminent_netorare
body:
As [[netorare]] involves infidelity in which someone close to the protagonist (usually someone's lover, though the dilution of the word has meant that it has also been applied to friends, unrequited love interests, or even relatives) is usually unwillingly seduced and stolen away, imminent netorare involves images where that taking away will soon occur. 

Posts on Danbooru tagged with this should include [[doujin cover]]s for doujin where the theme is netorare; pools and parent posts where the end result is netorare; and the moments before netorare occurs. The one taking the loved one can be present, but cannot be actively penetrating or otherwise taking the loved one.

title: happy_chaos
body:
A character introduced in [[Guilty Gear]] [[Guilty Gear Strive|Strive]].

He is the main antagonist of the Story Mode and [spoiler]former mentor to [[Asuka R. Kreutz]], as well as the discoverer of magic and the dimension that makes it possible. He was transformed into his current being as a result of him discovering [[I-no]] in said dimension.[/spoiler]

He is a mass manipulator, influencing events from beyond the Backyard and controlling individuals such as [[Nagoriyuki]] with his seemingly limitless magic abilities. In gameplay, he primarily uses two [[handgun|handguns]].

title: asuka_r._kreutz
body:
A mysterious character in [[Guilty Gear]]. Appears in several story modes and side material. He is the one who created the Gears, and various characters, including [[Sol Badguy]], [[Baiken]], and [[Axl Low]], are chasing after him for various reasons.

[spoiler]He turned one of his coworkers into the very first Gear, this person would later be renamed as Sol Badguy. He is also the actual person responsible for destroying Japan. However, he lost control over the Gears to the Universal Will and destroying Japan was a drastic response to the Universal Will doing something that would be far worse (basically, she was turning all Japanese people into Gear-shaped nukes), the event also made him lose control of [[Justice (guilty gear)|]].[/spoiler]

In official media prior to the reveal of his full name (and still very commonly in unofficial media up until his addition as a playable character in 2023), he was called simply "That Man", literally "あの男". His long period of activity, seclusion from humanity, and seemingly indecipherable actions across a wide range of appearances and aliases over hundreds of years led to him simply being referred to as That Man, as in, you-know-who.

[spoiler]It would later be revealed that Asuka had done very few of the crimes he was believed to; the real "That Man" was, in fact, [[Happy Chaos]].[/spoiler]

title: zastava_m21
body:
A series of Serbian 5.56×45mm NATO [b][[assault rifle]]s[/b]. Heavily based on the [[kalashnikov rifle|AK platform]], it was designed by Marinko Petrović and manufactured by "Zastava Arms":[https://www.zastava-arms.rs/en/home/] since 2004.

The current models use a 1.5mm thick stamped receiver. The M21 can incorporate picatinny rails for mounting accessories like [[optical sight]]s, [[foregrip]]s, [[bipod]]s, etc.

The Zastava M21 is gas operated, long stroke piston with a rotating bolt locking system [[rifle]]. It features a hard chromium-plated, cold forged standard rifled or an optional polygonal rifled barrel, integrated 22mm [[muzzle device]] [[grenade launcher]], heavy-duty dark/black synthetic furniture similarly to the [[AK-74M]] with a polymer side-folding stock, and side optics rail as standard (optional adapter base for cover mounted picatinny rail also available). The rifle can also mount a 40mm [[underbarrel grenade launcher]]. It is fed with standard 30-round [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]. The cyclic rate of fire is 680 rounds per minute, sustained one is 120 RPM. 

h1. Variants
* [b]M21 A[/b] – Standard baseline assault rifle.
** M21 ABS – Built-in picatinny rail system.
* [b]M21 S[/b] – Compact short barrel assault rifle.
** M21 SBS – Built-in picatinny rail system.
* [b]M21 C[/b] – Carbine.
** M21 BS – Built-in picatinny rail system.

title: war_fan
body:
A Japanese war fan is a fan designed for use in warfare. Several types of war fans were used by the samurai class of feudal Japan and each had a different look and purpose.

There are three kinds of war fan:

Gunsen (軍扇) were folding fans used by the average warriors to cool themselves off. They were made of wood, bronze, brass or a similar metal for the inner spokes, and often used thin iron or other metals for the outer spokes or cover, making them lightweight but strong. Warriors would hang their fans from a variety of places, most typically from the belt or the breastplate, though the latter often impeded the use of a sword or a bow. Example: post #2540638

[[Tessen]] (鉄扇) were folding fans with outer spokes made of heavy plates of iron which were designed to look like normal, harmless folding fans or solid clubs shaped to look like a closed fan. Samurai could take these to places where swords or other overt weapons were not allowed, and some swordsmanship schools included training in the use of the tessen as a weapon. The tessen was also used for fending off knives and darts, as a throwing weapon, and as an aid in swimming. Example: post #1904493

[[Gunbai]] (Gumbai), Gunpai (Gumpai) or dansen uchiwa (軍配) were large solid open fans that could be solid iron, metal with wooden core, or solid wood, which were carried by high-ranking officers. They were used to ward off arrows, as a sunshade, and to signal to troops. Also used by scoring referees in sumo wrestling matches. Example: post #1990137

title: hanzo_hasashi
body:
[[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] character. A member of the Shirai Ryu clan of [[ninja]].

In the first two timelines, he was one of the greatest assassins of the Shirai Ryu, but Hanzo would be killed in an attack that claimed his wife [[Harumi Shirai|Harumi]], his son [[Satoshi Hasashi|Satoshi]] and his entire clan. He would be brought back as the undead ninja specter known as [[Scorpion (mortal kombat)|]]. Burning with rage, Scorpion sought vengeance against the Lin Kuei, the Chinese ninjas responsible for the attack, and [[Sub-Zero]] in particular for killing him. But unbeknownst to Hanzo, the demon sorcerer [[Quan Chi]] was the true author of the events that led to the fall of his clan and his family's deaths.

In the original timeline, he would remain eternal rivals with the second Sub-Zero, [[Kuai Liang]]. In the rebooted timeline, he would learn the truth behind his fall of his clan, and make peace with the Lin Kuei to fight against Quan Chi. As such, up until 2023, all depictions of Scorpion were Hanzo. In the [[Mortal Kombat 1 (2023)|third timeline]], the position of Scorpion would be taken over by Kuai Liang. [spoiler]He would end up joining the then-newly-formed Shirai Ryu under Scorpion as a kid.[/spoiler] In the first season of MK1's Invasion Mode, Hanzo's Scorpion appears as 'Hellfire Scorpion', invading after defeating Kronika in his timeline, attempting to find a Harumi to be with, which ultimately ends with [spoiler][[Liu Kang]] finding a timeline for him where she was alone... because the Hanzo of her timeline had died, resulting in her becoming Scorpion instead.[/spoiler]

title: winged_victory_mercy
body:
[[Official alternate costume]] of [[Mercy (Overwatch)|]] from [[Overwatch]], depicting her wearing [[Ancient Greek clothes]].

Wears a [[laurel crown]], a [[chiton]], with a short [[peplos]] pinned over it using two fibula brooches. 

The peplos is an exaggerated Spartan-style peplos, with side slits. This is worn to give a [[pelvic curtain]] or a 'tabard'-like appearance. Most fan artists will not depict the peplos. Instead Mercy's upper garments will be merged into a single [[chiton]] 'dress', with the brooch-pins being purely vestigial. Such cases should not be tagged [[peplos]].

The crotch flap and other dangly cloth bits may often be depicted as wrapped around her other clothes. Tagging [[himation]] would be appropriate then.

title: great_black-backed_gull
body:

Sometimes mistakingly called "greatER black backed gull". Might be confused with the yellow legged lesser black backed gull (Larus fuscus) at a distance and where the feet aren't visible.

body:

She leads the Ynnari, a faction of Eldar that worship Ynnead, Eldar God of the Dead.

She is often [[shipping (fandom)|shipped]] with the [[Ultramarines]] primarch [[Roboute Guilliman]] due to her role in awakening him.

title: ork_(warhammer)
body:
Playable race in [[Warhammer 40k]], the Orks are green-skinned fungus-based alien life forms who are completely obsessed with fighting, much like football hooligans in England, yelling "[[Waaagh!]]" as their battle cry. Notable for using the onomatopoeia "dakka" to describe the sound their beloved fully-automatic firearms make when firing continuously.

"”More Dakka!!”":[/pools/1388], an internet meme meaning something like "more firepower!!", originates from the tabletop game.

h4.See also

* [[Orc]] - similar humanoid race which orkz is based on.

title: eldar
body:
One of the main factions in [[Warhammer 40K]], the Eldar (stylized as Aeldari) are a highly-psychic, [[elf]]-like race whose history stretches back millions of years before the current setting. Once the most powerful empire in the galaxy, the Eldar would fall to unprecedented decadence and corruption, resulting in the formation of the Chaos god Slannesh and the fall of their empire (and with it, finishing off humanity's already-weakened pre-[[imperium of man|Imperial]] government, starting the Age of Strife). A few would survive aboard massive Craftworlds, having seen the impending fall and evacuating ahead of time. The Fall, however, continues to haunt their species, as Eldar who die and whose souls are not transferred to a special Soulstone are instead consumed by Slannesh.

In recent editions given the increased threat [[Chaos (warhammer)|]] poses to the galaxy, some Eldar groups have begrudgingly cooperated with the Imperium of Man, given their common enemy.

h4. See also

* [[Dark Eldar]]

title: alphamon
body:
A Holy Knight [[Digimon]]. Alphamon is a massive armored Digimon with a cape and wings. It is a natural carrier of the X-Antibody and displays it as a red triangle on its forehead. It is a member of the Royal Knights, and acts as the group's leader when present.

Alphamon is the Vaccine-attribute Ultimate form of the troubled [[DORUmon]]; its evolutionary brethren are [[DORUgoramon]] and [[Death-X-DORUgoramon]]. Its titles are "Aloof Hermit" (孤高の隠士, [i]Kokou no Inshi[/i]) and "Empty Seat" (空白の席, [i]Kuuhaku no Seki[/i]), both making reference to its habit of disappearing without a trace. 

It can merge with [[Ouryumon]], at which point it is referred to as [[Alphamon Ouryuuken]]. In this form, Ouryumon turns into a blade for Alphamon to wield, and its wings show more prominently.


According to [[Watanabe Kenji]], Alphamon's design is based on [[Zwarth]] ([[Seisenshi Dunbine]]) and [[Type J-9 Griffon]] ([[Kidou Keisatsu Patlabor]]).

A popular chapter of the [[Adeptus Astartes]] from the [[Warhammer 40k]] franchise, distinguished by their bright red armor.

One of the original Space Marine legions, led by their [[Primarch]], [[Sanguinius]]. While they and most of their successor chapters are normally among the more compassionate groups of Space Marines, they suffer from two distinct flaws: the Red Thirst, which temporarily fills them with an insatiable bloodlust, and the Black Rage, in which a Marine suffers a lasting flashback to the death of Sanguinius and goes completely berserk. The latter is often incurable and sufferers are organized into "Death Companies".

title: space_wolves
body:
A chapter of the [[Adeptus Astartes]] in [[Warhammer 40k]]. Clad in primarily grey power armor, they are known for their Norse/Viking aesthetic and frequent references to wolves. Because of the latter trait, many in the fandom often joke about them being Furries. They are one of the original Space Marine legions and their [[Primarch]] is [[Leman Russ]], whose name would be used for the [[astra militarum|Imperial Guard's]] main battle tanks.

Their [[power armor|armor]] is colored in [[grey|grey armor]] or [[blue armor|blue]], with the [[shoulder armor]] colored in other colors as yellow, red, white or black. They heavily utilize symbology related to the wolves and often have feral aspects, with [[long hair]] and [[long beard]]s.

h4. External links 

* "Wiki page on Lexicanum":[https://wh40k.lexicanum.com/wiki/Space_Wolves]

title: julius_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Julius[/b] (ユリウス, [b]Yurius[/b] in the Japanese version) is a boss character from [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]].

[spoiler]Julius is one of twin children born from the union of [[Arvis (fire emblem)|Arvis]] and [[Deirdre (Fire Emblem)|Deirdre]], the other being his sister and opposite [[Julia (Fire Emblem)|Julia]]. This also makes him the younger half-brother of [[Seliph (Fire Emblem)|Seliph]]. Being a full-blooded descendant of the Earth Dragon Loptous, Julius is the final result of [[Manfroy (Fire Emblem)|Manfroy]]'s schemes to groom an heir to the mad god. He was eventually consumed by the dragon's spirit, and proceeds to turn his father's empire into a twisted, barbaric land resembling the old Lopt Empire. He meets his end by Julia and the power of [[Naga (Fire Emblem)|]], the Divine Dragon goddess.[/spoiler]

title: lavinia_whateley_(fate)
body:
A non-playable character in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s story chapter [i]Epic of Remnant IV: Heretical Salem[/i]. She is a close friend of [[Abigail Williams (fate)|]] and the same age as her.

She is an [[albino]], with [[white hair]] and [[purple eyes]] (sometimes closer to black or gray due to their paleness,) and has a [[single horn]]. Her eyes are always [[wide-eyed|wide]] and have [[bags under eyes|bags]] under them. She normally wears a [[black dress]] with a butterfly pattern, a [[polka dot bow]] in her hair, and [[red footwear|red]] [[shoes]].

In the [[Lavinia Whateley (Emerald Float) (Fate)|Emerald Float]] [[Craft Essence (fate)|]], she wears a lacy [[black bikini]].

Her name is taken from the character [[Lavinia Whateley]] in H. P. Lovecraft's short story [[The Dunwich Horror]], but she has relatively little in common with the Lovecraft character.

h4. Costumes

* [[lavinia_whateley_(emerald_float)_(fate)|Emerald Float]] (black bikini Lavinia)

h4. See also

* [[List of Fate series characters]]

h4. External links

title: daring_tact_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]"Daring" from her dam's name. "Tact" is short for "tactics".[/tn]
Real-life Japanese Racehorse. Sired by Epiphaneia (from [[Symboli Kris S (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Cesario, a daughter of [[Special Week (racehorse)|]]) and foaled by Daring Bird. She became famous as the first undefeated Japanese Triple Tiara in 2020 but victory eluded her afterwards. She went on a hiatus after the 2022 Queen Elizabeth II Cup in Hong Kong due to injuries, resting for over a year before returning to race only to stop again due to more injuries after the 2022 Japan Cup. She was eventually retired on October 6 2023 due to her leg issues not having improved since then.

She is a brown mare with a small star marking (itself roughly shaped like a star) and no leg markings.

She is also famous for her firsts in [i][[Umamusume]][/i], being the first horse to be implemented while still being active as well as the first triple tiara to be unveiled.

She is also infamous for her [[meme|memetic]] "interview" during her hiatus which features her taking a bath and making a face while subtitles rolls below her, which makes her look like she's mouthing what the actual interviewee is saying. This led to jokes about her being the voice actress of her own Umamusume counterpart (e.g.: post #5722302).

h5. Related
* [[Contrail (racehorse)|]] - Contemporary and Triple Crown winner of the same year

title: primaris_space_marine
body:
A new breed of transhuman [[adeptus astartes|Space Marines]] in [[Warhammer 40K]], developed across the span of ten thousand standard years by Archmagos Dominus Belisarius Cawl on Mars on the order of Primarch [[Roboute Guilliman]]. Cawl used the genetic template of the original Space Marines created by the Emperor for His Great Crusade as the starting point for the development of the new Astartes. Primaris Space Marines are bigger, more physically powerful and possess faster reaction times than their original Astartes counterparts.

The way to different them from a regular Space Marine is their height and equipment, wearing the Mark X Tacticus Pattern Power Armour.

title: blood_ravens
body:
A chapter of the [[Adeptus Astartes]] from [[Warhammer 40K]]. First introduced in the PC RTS game [[Dawn of War]], the chapter have since appeared in both the tabletop and other 40k games as well. The chapter is known from their red armor and their emblem, a raven with a blood drop on its chest.

While generally well received amongst (most of) the Imperium for their protective nature over civilians and eagerness to deal death to the enemies of the Imperium, the Techpriests of Mars and the Inquisition due to their voracious appetite for knowledge, learning and artifacts in particular, the Blood Ravens have a mixed reputation amongst the other Space Marine chapters due to both their strategies (favoring extensive recon, meticulous planning and pinpoint assaults on key enemy vulnerabilities) and their Chapter-wide tendency to produce almost unprecedented numbers of psykers and Librarians. The Space Wolves (who favor strategies involving charges and overwhelming the foe in massed melee) infamously do not tolerate Blood Raven procedures at all, with physical altercations being recorded between the two chapters at command-level meetings.

As a second-founding chapter with no official records prior to M37K, the Blood Ravens do not (again officially) have a recognizable Primarch. However, their color scheme, tendency to produce psykers and culture surrounding the acquisition of knowledge strongly suggest that they are descendants of [[Magnus the Red]], making them loyalists of the [[Thousand Sons]] traitor legion. This would also make them an indirect relative chapter of the [[Grey Knight]]s due to sharing a Founder in Janus.

As the Blood Raven arsenal contains some phenomenally unlikely artifacts (Gear belonging to the Custodes and [i]Primarchs[/i] to name but a few) that would have been under enough security to make their theft near impossible, the Blood Ravens gained the fandom reputation of being able to perform implausible acts of indefinite borrowing, such as swapping places with a Land Raider's driver while he's still inside the cockpit, acquiring Bjorn the Fell-handed's Dreadnaught for combat use (with Bjorn catching on quickly to his new circumstances and happily embracing the chance to go back to war) and involuntarily renting the Golden Throne of Terra. 

The chapter have been jokingly called "The Bloody Magpies" by fans due to how the chapter are constantly gifted (or 'gifted', due to those same chapters not having any records stating that they ever gave the Ravens anything)  rare, powerful weapons and gear from other older chapters.  
Due to their memetic shenanigans, gateway status to the 40k world and generally being a interesting chapter, the Blood Ravens are well-regarded amongst the fandom - even if the jokes about rampant theft get a little repetitive.

title: a.k.i._(street_fighter)
body:
A [[Street Fighter]] character, first revealed as the second season 1 DLC character for [[Street Fighter 6]].

While still a teenager, A.K.I lived a life of poverty until she encountered [[F.A.N.G]], who noted her spirit and accept her as a disciple. She later developed obsessive affection towards F.A.N.G for teaching everything he knew about the art of poisoning and for giving her the meaning of life. Because of this, A.K.I devoted herself in accomplishing various tasks in hope of impressing her "master".

Notable for her gleeful yet sadistic and psychopathic personality, as well as her "snake-like" mannerisms.

title: biolizard
body:
The final boss of [[Sonic Adventure 2]]. It appears as a large, red [[lizard]] with multiple mechanical contraptions across its body. It was created at the [[space_colony_ark|ARK]] by Professor [[Gerald Robotnik]] as a prototype of the Ultimate Life Form during Project Shadow. It was capable of multiple physical feats, such as using Chaos Control, but needed a life support system to sustain itself.

50 years after its creation, it would try to take the ARK into a collision course towards the Earth, but it was stopped by its eventual successor, [[shadow_the_hedgehog|Shadow]], along with [[sonic_the_hedgehog|Sonic]].

body:
"Strawberry White Dress" / いちご白無垢 ([i]ichigo shiro muku[/i])

The 2013 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme this year was お菓子 (Sweets) showing the imagery of Hokkaido winter, with the winning design by [[nijita18]] having an [[ichigo daifuku]] motif.

Her fan nickname is "Shiromuku".

She has [[green hair|green]] or [[aqua hair]] and wears a white [[shiromuku]] with a [[wataboushi]] while often holding an [[oil-paper umbrella]].

title: mortal_kombat_(series)
body:
A series of fighting games initially developed by Midway Games, starting in 1992 for the Sega Genesis, SNES and arcades. It has grown infamous for its violent Fatality finishers, which were so graphic that it helped lead to the creation of the Entertainment Software Rating Board (ESRB) and the ratings systems used today for video games.

Since Midway's takeover by [[Warner Bros]] in 2006, the studio was reorganized into Netherealm Studios, which has continued to develop the series since. Later games have become known for featuring guest characters from various properties, ranging from comic books to Hollywood horror franchises.

In Japan, after Mortal Kombat Trilogy on PS1 in 1998, official releases largely stopped due to lack of popularity, with the mobile release of Mortal Kombat X since 2015 presenting an exception before games were available to Japanese via online platforms again.

h4. Tagged games

* [[Mortal Kombat Trilogy]] (1996)
* [[Mortal Kombat 4]] (1997)
* [[Mortal Kombat: Shaolin Monks]] (2005)
* [[Mortal Kombat vs DC Universe]] (2008)
* [[Mortal Kombat 9]] (2011)
* [[Mortal Kombat X]] (2015)
* [[Mortal Kombat 11]] (2019)
* [[Mortal Kombat 1 (2023)|]] (2023)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mortal Kombat":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mortal_Kombat

title: fox_news
body:
[b]Fox News[/b] is an American conservative news channel owned by media mogul Rupert Murdoch. Despite the channel's claims it's trustworthy, Fox News is accused by many for promoting racist, far right wing views and politics and attacking anyone who don't fit their views, especially liberal and left wing politicians with false claims and accusations. 

The channel was heavily criticized during the US 2020 elections for repeatedly claiming the election was rigged and [[Donald Trump]] was still the US President and not the actual winner [[Joe Biden]] despite evidence and testimony by all politicians and election officials that there was no election rigging, which led to the infamous January 6 2021 United States Capitol attack when Trump supporters tried and failed to takeover the US Capitol building.

title: nibutani_shinka
body:
Character from [[Chuunibyou Demo Koi ga Shitai!]]




[[Nibutani Shinka]] is a beautiful girl who has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied into a [[side ponytail|ponytail]] along with a pink [[hairclip]]. She also has [[orange eyes]] and is a tall girl.

During the start of the first episode of Ren she dyes her hair [[black hair|black]] which lacks a ponytail and a hairclip along with wearing a much [[long skirt|longer]] [[skirt]] in order to keep her identity a secret, but fails at the end of the first episode as she changes back into her old appearance, but during the finale she briefly wears her hair in [[twin braids]], round [[glasses]] and [[white socks]].

She's a Class Representative (and originally a [[cheerleader]], but later joins the drama club as of Ren) from [[Togashi Yuuta]]'s class who, like him, used to be diagnosed with a chuunibyou in which she labeled herself as "[[Mori Summer]]", but then moved to Icho Private Highschool in order to escape her horribly embarrassing past. She often tends to fight with [[Dekomori Sanae]] because of it in achieving the goal of erasing the traces of her own past as Mori Summer for good.

Shinka is generally described as a gorgeous and friendly girl in the anime, and is popular among her peers due to her good looks. However, she shows her blunt and edgy side when she's alone [[takanashi rikka|Rikka]], [[Togashi Yuuta|Yuuta]] and others, particularly whenever it comes to dealing with [[Dekomori Sanae]], who doesn't know is the real [[Mori Summer]]. She usually takes her frustration out on her whenever she says "fake Mori Summer" and feeding her milk, which Sanae deems poisonous, but it's later revealed that they actually care for each other and vice-versa. 

Despite her flaws, she's a genuinely kindhearted girl who cares deeply about her friends/clubmates, and doesn't hesitate to help them whenever they need it. In Episode 7, it is revealed that she's enthusiastic when it comes to romance, but in Episode 9 Shinka makes it fairly clear that Rikka and Yuuta must be together, and often tends to help them on their relationship.

title: ore_to_mahou_no_koibito
body:
2004 [[bara]] visual novel by [[Underground Campaign (circle)|]]. It stars Simba, a magician in training; searching for love. Using the Spellbook of Almagest in hopes of acquiring a boyfriend, he accidentally summons four men from different worlds. With inspections approaching within a month, if Simba doesn’t return them home in time, he may be forced to renounce his magicianship.

[[Senga Migiri]] of the circle announced in 2013 that the full visual novel was now available for free download, releasing the exact same version that previously had to be purchased in stores online. For anyone interested in downloading it, the game may have problems starting up correctly due to not being supported by current operating systems. Before launching the game, make sure you have your system locale set for Japanese language. You can find this in the Language settings in Control Panel. To prevent it from crashing, right click on or.exe, and enable Windows XP Compatibility mode.

h4. External links
* "Original site":[http://ugcp.sakura.ne.jp/oremaho.html]
* "Free release announcement translation by BaraGamer":[http://baragamer.com/2013/03/04/me-and-my-magical-boyfriends-bara-game-is-free/]
* "Visual Novel Database":[https://vndb.org/v13815]

title: purple_pikmin
body:
[b]Scientific name:[/b] [i]Pikminidae [[sumo|yokozunum]][/i]

A variety of [[Pikmin (creature)|]] that first appears in [[Pikmin 2]]. 
Their bodies are purple in color and they occasionally have a [[purple flower|purple]] [[flower]] on their head. They are much larger than other Pikmin (10x heavier) and have small hairs on their head.
Due to their weight, they are useful for certain puzzles and don't trip as much, but are also much slower. They are also very strong, being 10x stronger than other Pikmin.

h4. External links

* "Pikmin Wiki: Purple Pikmin":https://www.pikminwiki.com/Purple_Pikmin

title: yu_yu_hakusho
body:
A manga series written and drawn by Togashi Yoshihiro, later adapted into an anime series. The manga ran from 1990 to 1994 from [[Weekly Shounen Jump]] and the anime from 1992 to 1995.

Teenage delinquent [[Urameshi Yusuke]] surprised the Underworld when, in an uncharacteristic act of altruism, he was killed saving a boy from a speeding car. With no place prepared for him in either Heaven or Hell, Yuusuke was returned to the living world, but not before he was recruited by [[Koenma]], son of the ruler of the Underworld, to become Spirit Detective, charged with investigating supernatural activity in the human world.

h4. See also

title: kyoukai_no_kanata
body:
novel illustrated by [[Kamoi Tomoyo]]

The dark fantasy follows a high school sophomore named Kanbara Akihito. Although the boy appears human, he is half youmu and invulnerable to wounds because he can heal quickly. One day, Akihito meets freshman Kuriyama Mirai when it seems she is about to jump from the school rooftop. Mirai is isolated because of her ability to manipulate blood, which is unique even among members of the spirit world. Disturbing events begin to unfold after Akihito saves Mirai.

Released in North America late 2015 by Sentai Filmworks under the title of [i]Beyond the Boundary[/i].

title: gundam_calibarn
body:
The final lead [[mobile suit]] in [[Gundam Suisei no Majo]]. It is piloted by [[Suletta Mercury]] after the [[Gundam Aerial Rebuild]] [spoilers], which possesses the consciousness of [[Ericht Samaya]], rejected her and reunites with their mother, [[Prospera Mercury]], for their [[Quiet Zero]] Plan.[/spoilers]

It was in a competition against the [[Gundam Lfrith]] in choosing Ochs Earth Corporation's main Gundam, but the latter was ultimately chosen due to the former lacking features to ensure pilot safety from the GUND Format (ex. filters to reduce the feedback from the GUND Format data storm). The Gundam Calibarn was later seized by the Space Assembly League during the Vanadis Incident, where it was called a "monster" due to its deadly characteristics. 

The Gundam Calibarn's primary weapon is a [[beam cannon]]/long [[beam rifle]] with four [[thrusters|thruster]] units at the back, giving it an appearance of a [[witch]]'s [[broom]]stick. Later on, [spoilers]it gained access and control of the Aerial Rebuild's [[bit (gundam)|GUND-BITs]].[/spoilers]

Just like the Lfrith and [[Gundam Aerial|Aerial]]/Rebuild, the Calibarn is designed by [[JNT]].

title: big_sis_prinny_(disgaea)
body: [[Makai Senki Disgaea]] character. A strange red [[Prinny]] who speaks in a woman's voice and does not end her sentences with "dood". She isn't directly named in the game, so she is referred to as Big Sis by the other Prinnies. [spoiler]She is [[Laharl's mother]] reincarnated as a Prinny to atone for the sin of committing suicide to save his life.[/spoiler]

title: prinny
body:
Penguin-like dolls from the [[Disgaea]] video game series, and other titles by [[Nippon Ichi]].  They are mascot minions.  Prinnies explode on impact when thrown, dood.  Prinnies contain the souls of humans or demons who lead a criminal life or committed a grave sin, and have to work in Celestia (Heaven) or the Netherworld (Hell) to pay off their debts and reincarnate as something else. It's stated somewhere that you also become a Prinny if you lead a meaningless life.

Prinnies slur the words at the end of their sentences as "~ッス", or in English localizations, say "dood" at the end of sentence, dood.

[[Kazamatsuri Fuuka]] is a notable "prinny" from Disgaea 4 who wasn't fully converted into a prinny, and instead looks and acts as a girl with a prinny hat on and doesn't explode, in spite of her technical prinny status.  Other characters who die in Disgaea frequently reappear as prinnies, including some bad endings, but they are [[spoilers]]. 

There are some Prinnies who break the usual standards of being one, though those instances tend to be rare. [[Big Sis Prinny (disgaea)|]] is the first to break tradition by having a woman's voice. Another is the giant yellow Prinny that [[Usalia (disgaea)|]] rides around on during battles, which doesn’t have a name and never speaks. Another is [[Pii-chan (disgaea)|]], a bright yellow cat-themed Prinny who serves as [[Pirilika (disgaea)|]]’s secretary and speaks like a normal person.

Voiced by [[Majima Junji]].

title: akutare_(disgaea)
body: A recurring character seen throughout the [[Disgaea]] franchise. Renamed to [b]Axel[/b] for the English version.

title: ranger_(disgaea)
body:
The male version of the Archer class, introduced [[Makai Senki Disgaea 3]]. His default colors are short blonde hair, a red coat and black pants.

For the female version, see [[archer (disgaea)]].

title: gunslinger_(disgaea)
body:
The female version of the Gunner class, introduced in [[Makai Senki Disgaea 3]]. Her default colors are brown hair, red eyes, and a red-colored cowboy hat, shorts and chaps.

For the male version used in all the other games, see [[gunner (disgaea)]].

title: suisen_(disgaea)
body: [[Makai Senki Disgaea 7]] character. A young boy who works for the shogunate as one of the 13 Magistrates. He can make predictions on what will happen in the near future, and approaches everything in his life with a similar rationale. He joins the party not because he wants to, but because he is kidnapped early in the story. He gradually warms up to the concept of friendship, and that not everything needs to be predictable.

title: ceefore_(disgaea)
body: [[Makai Senki Disgaea 7]] character. A mysterious kunoichi who claims to have amnesia. She is searching for the Infernal Treasures to sell on the market, and brands herself as a chivalrous thief. She is a weapon otaku, and is addicted to anything related with gunpowder, bombs, and/or explosions. Her name is a play on [b]C-4[/b], a type of plastic explosive.

title: pirilika_(disgaea)
body: [[Makai Senki Disgaea 7]] character. The main heroine, a cat-girl who is not from the Hinomoto Netherworld, but is a huge fan of the culture and initially travels there on holiday. When she sees how degraded the concept of bushido has become, she vows to fix things by confronting the shogunate, hiring [[Fuji (disgaea)|]] as her bodyguard in the process. She is always positive, sometimes to the point of being delusional. She also constantly screws up common idioms, forcing the others to correct her. [[Pii-chan (disgaea)|]] is her Prinny secretary.

title: pii-chan_(disgaea)
body: [[Makai Senki Disgaea 7]] character. [[Pirilika (disgaea)|]]'s [[Prinny]] secretary. Unlike typical Prinnies, he has bright yellow skin, cat ears and fake whiskers, and does not end his sentences with "dood".

title: higan_zesshousai
body: [[Makai Senki Disgaea 7]] character. [[Fuji (disgaea)|]]'s swordsman master, she is an exceptionally strong demon who can fight thousands at once, but loses her cool unless she is fed copious amounts of sweets. [b]Higan[/b] is her given name, while [b]Zesshousai[/b] is a title bestowed to warriors who take an oath.

title: fuji_(disgaea)
body: [[Makai Senki Disgaea 7]] character. The main protagonist, a wandering ronin who uses dirty tactics to win, and only cares about making money to pay off his debts. He meets [[Pirilika (disgaea)|]] and enters into a contract to be her bodyguard for the adventure. He is allergic to empathy, causing him to cough up blood whenever he shows compassion for others, forcing him to act like a cruel-hearted demon. [[Higan Zesshousai]] is his swordsman master, and [[Ao (disgaea)|]] claims to be his daughter.

title: ao_(disgaea)
body: [[Makai Senki Disgaea 7]] character. A young demon who claims that [[Fuji (disgaea)|]] is her father. She is quite destructive and has been going on a rampage across Hinomoto, presumably for his sake.

title: old_maid
body:
A [[card game]] for two or more players.

An extra card, usually a [[joker (playing card)|]] or "old maid" card, is inserted into a regular deck of [[playing card]]s. The cards are then dealt to the players who then take turns selecting a card from another player's hand. If a pair is formed, it is discarded. This continues until one player is left holding the "old maid". This is the variation often seen in Japan; the original rules call for removal of three queens, while other rule sets dictate the removal of either one queen, three jacks, one jack, three cards of the same value, or any card whatsoever.

h4.See also

* [[poker face failure]], for charisma break typically during this game
* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_maid_%28card_game%29

title: lynx
body:
A medium-size wild [[cat]] of the genus [i]Lynx[/i]. Notable features of lynxes include their short tails, black hair tufts on the tips of their ears, and relatively large padded paws adept at walking on snow.

The four species of Lynx are: Canada lynx, Iberian lynx, Eurasian lynx, and bobcat.

title: downtown_nekketsu_monogatari
body:
[i][b]Downtown Nekketsu Monogatari[/b][/i] (ダウンタウン熱血物語, [i]Hot-Blooded Downtown Tale[/i]) is a 1989 beat 'em up/RPG console [[video game]] released on the [[Nintendo]] [[Famicom]]. It's part of the [[Kunio-Kun series]].

It is about a schoolboy named [[Kunio-Kun]] who teams up with a former rival named Riki in order to save Riki's girlfriend from the Reihou Gakuen gang.

While mostly an action martial arts game, Downtown Nekketsu Monogatari was unique in the fact that it also combined many RPG elements in its [[gameplay mechanics]]. The player's character can interact with several citizens in the streets to obtain information, buy several types of food to replenish health or buy items in stores and learn techniques in academies that enhance his [[martial arts]] abilities. All this with money obtained from defeated enemies ("BARF!!!").

The game was released as [i][b]River City Ransom[/b][/i] for the [[NES]] console in the US during the same year. The creator of the comic [[Scott Pilgrim (series)|]] has cited this port of the game as an important influence on his work.
 
It was also released as [i][b]Street Gangs[/b][/i] in Europe.

h4. See also

* [[Nekketsu Kouha Kunio-Kun]]

This tag can be used for other [i]Sonic[/i] franchise characters with Werehog transformations. Ones specifically dealing with Sonic also need the [[Sonic the Werehog]]  tag.

title: sonic_team
body:
The in-house [[Sega]]-owned development team for video games of the [[Sonic (series)|]] series since the [[Sega Mega Drive|Genesis/Mega Drive]] era. They were originally known as [b]Sega AM8[/b] prior to the 90's and are responsible for the development processes for the [[sonic adventure|Sonic]] [[sonic adventure 2|Adventure]] games, [[Sonic Heroes]], [[shadow the hedgehog (game)|Shadow The Hedgehog]], [[Sonic Riders]], [[sonic the hedgehog (2006)|Sonic 2006]], [[Sonic Unleashed]], etc. Also worked on the handheld games on the [[Game Boy Advance]] and [[Nintendo DS]], namely the [[Sonic Advance]] and [[sonic rush|Rush]] games with the help of the developer, Dimps. The team has also developed other Sega games like [[nights into dreams|NiGHTS into dreams…]], the [[Phantasy Star]] series, [[Burning Rangers]], [[PuyoPuyo Fever]], [[Samba de Amigo]], [[Billy Hatcher and the Giant Egg]], and [[Chu Chu Rocket]] respectively. Formerly lead by Naka Yuji, now under the leadership of Iizuka Takashi.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sonic Team":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sonic_Team
* "Wikipedia (Japanese): Sonic Team":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%BD%E3%83%8B%E3%83%83%E3%82%AF%E3%83%81%E3%83%BC%E3%83%A0
* "Wikipedia: List of Sonic Team games":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Sonic_Team_games

title: sonic_unleashed
body:
[b]Sonic Unleashed[/b] (known as [b]Sonic World Adventure[/b] in Japan) is a 2008 action-adventure platformer game developed by [[Sonic Team]] and published by [[Sega]] for the Wii, PlayStation 2, Xbox 360, and PlayStation 3.

The game follows [[Sonic the Hedgehog]] as he attempts to restore the world to normal after his nemesis, [[Dr. Eggman]], splits the world's continents into pieces with a powerful new ray weapon and the power of the Chaos Emeralds to harness the power of [[Dark Gaia]], as well as his struggles with his new beast form generated by Dark Gaia's energies, [[Sonic the Werehog]]. With [[Chip (Sonic)|]]'s help, Sonic must travel around the globe to both return to his normal form and stop Dr. Eggman from breaking up the world.

h4. External links
* "Sonic Retro: Sonic Unleashed":http://info.sonicretro.org/Sonic_Unleashed
* "Wikipedia: Sonic Unleashed":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sonic_Unleashed

title: spotty_bulbear
body: Scientific Name: Oculus terribilis dotticum A subspecies of [[Bulborb]] that appears throughout the [[Pikmin_(series)|]] series. They are recognized compared to other varieties by their black backs with red spots, as well as having larger lips. Bulbears are notably one of the few species of Bulborb that can be found awake during the day, patrolling a large territory in search of potential prey, usually with up to three [[dwarf bulbear|dwarf bulbears]] in tow. h4. External links * "Pikmin Wiki: Spotty Bulbear":[https://www.pikminwiki.com/Spotty_Bulbear]

title: bulborb
body: Scientific Name: Oculus kageyamii russus A common enemy in the [[Pikmin (series)|]] series, as well as arguably its most iconic. It is a bipedal creature of varying sizes with a beige face and has a red back with white spots, though their color may vary between different sub species. h4. External links * "Pikmin Wiki: Bulborb":[https://www.pikminwiki.com/Bulborb]

title: what_is_a_man?
body:
[quote]
Richter Belmont: Die, monster! You don't belong in this world!
Dracula: It was not by my hand that I'm once again given flesh. I was called here by humans who wish to pay me tribute.
Richter: "Tribute"?! You steal men's souls, and make them your slaves!
Dracula: Perhaps the same could be said of all religions.
Richter: Your words are as empty as your soul! Mankind ill needs a savior such as you!
Dracula: What is a man? [flings his wine glass aside] A miserable little pile of secrets! But enough talk! Have at you!
[/quote]

A [[meme]] originating from a dialogue between [[Richter Belmont]] and [[Dracula (castlevania)|]] in the prologue of [[Castlevania: Symphony of the Night]]. The dialogue has been widely parodied for its over-the-top delivery.

This quote is not present in the Japanese version, and in fact, it originates from a quote from the French author André Malraux's book "Antimémoires".

Use this tag for parodies of the scene or dialogue.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Die Monster / What Is A Man?":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/die-monster-what-is-a-man

title: potbelly_stove
body:
A potbelly stove is a cylindrical device that bulges in the middle with a flat stove surface on the top.  They used wood or coal as fuel and were used for both heating and cooking.

The  name is derived from the bulge in the middle, which was reminiscent of a fat person's pot belly.

h4. See also

* [[Heater]]
* "Wikipedia - Potbelly stove":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potbelly_stove]

title: gears
body:
A mechanical part of a clockwork system, a gear is a wheel with so-called flanks so it will interlock with other gears and spin. Radius of the wheel and edge sizes allow spinning at different speeds and thus make processing different. Obviously used the most in non-digital [[watch|watches]]. An important part of [[steampunk]] culture.

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Technology]]

title: rhodesia
body:
[b]Rhodesia[/b] was a [[United Kingdom|British]] colony and later an unrecognised country in Africa, which is now [[Zimbabwe]] and parts of [[Zambia]]. Ruled by the white minority with similar apatheid-like segregation laws with [[South Africa]], the country collapsed in 1980 after the Rhodesian Bush war and replaced by Zimbabwe.

The Rhodesian military is known for their usage of [[short shorts]], and for creating the [[Rhodesian Brushstroke]] camouflage pattern.

title: imperial_war_flag
body:
The Imperial War Flag (German: Reichskriegsflagge) was the war flag and war ensign of the Imperial German armed forces of the [[German Empire]]. It consists of a black nordic cross with the Prussian eagle in the center, over a white background, with the [[Imperial German flag]] defaced with an [[iron cross]] in the canton.

It was frequently used by neo-[[Nazi]] groups as a substitute for the banned [[Nazi flag]].

h4. See Also
* [[Imperial German Flag]]
* [[Nazi War Ensign]]

title: speed_limit_sign
body:
[[Road sign]] that shows the permitted maximum speed (in kilometer or mile) of a vehicle. It comes in various formats. In many countries such as the EU, Russia and Japan, they are simply encircled numbers. While in the US, the sign takes a rectangular shape and often contain all caps inscription that accompany the number.

h1. See also
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

title: double_penetration

May occur together with the [[spitroast|spitroast position]] and [[group sex]]. Also known as a "sandwich" and also abbreviated as "DP".

This can be seen at the same time as [[imminent double penetration]] if both the imminent penetration and actual penetration are depicted in the same image, typically a comic. (post #2363609)

title: shannan_(fire_emblem)
body:
A character from the second generation of [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]]. The crown prince of Isaach, he is the inheritor to the holy blade [[Balmung (Fire Emblem)|]] and the heir to Isaach. He is the elder cousin of [[Larcei (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Scathach (fire emblem)|]].

Together with [[Oifey (Fire Emblem)|]], Shannan raised [[Seliph (Fire Emblem)|]], his cousins and their fellow descendants of the first-generation party in the northern Isaachian village of Tirnanog. As such, Shannan and Seliph share a brotherly bond.

Holy Blood: [b]Od[/b] (major)

title: turnaround
body:
A character, often [[full body]], viewed form the same angle with different degrees of rotation while keeping the same pose and outfit. A technique commonly used on [[reference sheet]]s to demonstrate a character's entire design. This varies from a simple [[straight-on|front]] (0º) and [[from behind|back]] (180º) view to supplemental in-between angles such as the [[from side|side]] (90º) and 45º views.

For characters literally turning around for uses other than display, use [[turning around]] instead.

title: tiktok_dodging_trend_(meme)
body:
TikTok Dodging Trend is a trend set to "Forget" Slowed Down, a slowed-down remix of Pogo's song "Forget." The remix inspired the viral trend on TikTok in September 2022 where one user mock stabs and swings at another with a stick, bat or another object as they rhythmically dodge the stabs.
https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/tiktok-dodging-trend-forget-slowed-down-pogo

title: toca_toca_toca_dance_(meme)
body:
Toca Toca Toca Dance, also known as Toca Toca Dance or Toca Toca Anime Dance, refers to a dance trend in which both real people and animated characters mimic the movements of anime dances to the song "Toca Toca" by Fly Project. The trend became prevalent on TikTok and YouTube as multiple Toca Toca memes and animations surfaced in early 2023.
https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/toca-toca-toca-dance

Master of the Castle of Dreams and Keeper of the Cradle. A Victorian Operator who came to Rhodes Island to return a certain Operator's safekept items. [spoiler](Bluishsilver, who was killed in action during the Chernobog operation in [i]Chapter 8: Roaring Flare[/i])[/spoiler] Temporarily residing at Rhodes Island until all related matters are dealt with. Uses peculiar sleep-inducing Originium Arts and is able to control the contents of their dreams.

Her Chinese name "爱丽丝" can be read as [i]Alice[/i], which in conjunction with her motif and abilities, is a reference to [i]Alice's Adventures in Wonderland[/i].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Shiraishi Haruka (voice Actor)|]].

title: rutee_katrea
body:
The main heroine of [[Tales of Destiny]]. Rutee works as a Lens Hunter along with her partner [[Mary Argent]], and wields the Swordian of Water, Atwight. Many are annoyed by her greedy ways, but she doesn't let it bother her. She eventually marries [[Stahn Aileron]] and becomes the mother of [[Kyle Dunamis]]. Her seiyuu is [[imai yuka (voice actor)|Imai Yuka]].

[spoiler]Rutee discovers that she has a long-lost brother - he is Leon Magnus.[/spoiler]

One of Rim Billiton’s more famous explorers. Asbestos was recommended to Rhodes Island for treatment by Operator [[Magallan (Arknights)|]], and signed an agreement to become an operator after negotiation.

She has [[colored_inner_hair|colored inner hair]], wears a [[baseball cap]] and [[headphones]] on her head. She has a [[green_eyes|green eye]], while the other eye, typically covered by an [[eyepatch]] is [[purple_eyes|purple]]. In game, she's shown to wear a [[yellow jacket]] and a [[black bodysuit]]. The famous explorer carries around a personally modified [[shield]], [[lantern]] and a [[backpack]]. 

Due to her race, she has salamander aspects, like her [[lizard tail]] and [[sharp teeth]]. Her callsign is taken from a heat-resistant, fibrous silicate mineral.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Shindou Kei (voice Actor)|]].

title: garrod_ran
body:
Protagonist of [[After War Gundam X]]. Garrod is an "everyman" (read as: mercenary), casually doing tasks he's assigned with to survive. However, his life is permanently altered once he takes up the mission to locate a particular girl named [[Tiffa Adill]] and stumbles into the cockpit of the all-powerful [[Gundam X]]. He later on pilots the [[Gundam X Divider]] (remodeled version of his Gundam X unit after it got heavily damaged) and the [[Gundam Double X]] (Gundam X' direct successor).

Voiced by: [[Takagi Wataru (voice Actor)|]]

title: airfield_princess
body:
Airfield Princess is an enemy [[abyssal ship]] in [[Kantai Collection]]. She was the boss of the fourth event map during the Fall 2013 event.

She has [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[white_hair|white]] hair, [[orange eyes]], and small [[horns]]. She wears a white [[leotard]] and has two rows of two spikes each along her lower back. She also wears white [[ankle boots]] with two spikes underneath them. Her right arm seems to be either a [[single mechanical arm]] or wearing a [[gauntlets|gauntlet]] with claws.

She is nicknamed "Henderson-chan" or just "Henderson" as a reference to "Henderson Field":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henderson_Field_%28Guadalcanal%29, which is what she is based on.

h5.Voiced by:

* [[Ishigami Shizuka]] (2015- )
* [[Sakakibara Yoshiko]] (2015, [[Kantai Collection (Anime)|anime-only]])

An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category. Yukari is a prodigy flute soloist from the Amori region of Japan. She is refined and calm, although she's a little concerned about becoming an idol. She has played the flute in a classical style since childhood, and doesn’t use her flutist trait as an overt stage gimmick. Besides her hobby in flutes, she also has some interest in theater.

title: super_fumina
body:
[[Gundam Build Fighters Try]] character. A [[Mecha Musume]] and/or Armor Girls Project-esque fusion of [[Hoshino Fumina]] and her [[Powered GM Cardigan]], built (without her consent) by [[Sakai Minato]] of the Gunpla Shingyo School.

A Titans-themed maid recolor of this gunpla was released via the Premium Bandai online shop to commemorate the release of Gundam Build Fighters Try: Island Wars; an AEUG-themed maid recolor was a Gunpla EXPO World Japan limited release. Another variant -- inspired by the [[Qubeley]] -- was subsequently released as the Super Fumina Axis Angel. A [[Sazaki Kaoruko]] variant called the [[Hyper Gyanko]] and a combination with the [[Winning Gundam]] called the Winning Fumina were also released with the Build Fighters Battlogue series.

Its real life designer is [[Shimada Fumikane]], famous for designing various mecha musume.

h4. External links

* "Gundam Wiki: Super Fumina":[https://gundam.fandom.com/wiki/SF-01_Super_Fumina]

title: mexico_ufo_alien_bodies_hearing_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] referring to the Mexican Congress holding a hearing on September 12th, 2023, during which supposed "non-human" [[alien]] corpses were displayed to Mexican politicians.

The event was reportedly led by Mexican journalist and UFO enthusiast Jaime Maussan, who testified under oath to say that the two alien corpses retrieved were not part of "our terrestrial evolution." Following the congressional hearing, news of the purported aliens presented by Maussan became prominent topics of discourse and memes online. The event notably came a month after David Grusch testified to the U.S. Congress about UAPs.

There is also a trend of combining this meme with the [[guy tired after sex (meme)|]] meme.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Mexico UFO Alien Bodies Hearing":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/events/mexico-ufo-alien-bodies-hearing

title: team_kirby_clash_deluxe
body:
A free-to-play, 4-player co-op [[Kirby_(series)|]] game for the [[Nintendo 3DS]].

This is an expanded version of the [i]Team Kirby Clash[/i] minigame from [[Kirby: Planet Robobot]]. Unlike other [i]Kirby[/i] games, this game is free to start. The main currency is Gem Apples, which [[Magolor]] utlizes to run his Shoppe. Gem Apples are needed to progress through the game, and you can get them from completing tasks in-game or purchasing them from the [[Nintendo eShop]].

Like the original version, the gameplay is essentially nothing but boss fights, some of which only appear in this game.

title: magal_(miss_magal)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[Magal (girls' frontline)|]]'s first skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the post-anniversary 2021 'Basic Deduction' skin collection.

Magal does away with her usual tactical attire for a more 'traditional [[detective]]' look, putting on a [[white shirt]] with a [[corset]], paired with [[black pants|black]] [[asymmetrical pants]] (her right leg ending at short length and having a [[thigh strap]]), completed with a [[hat]] and [[brown coat|brown]] [[coat]] whose sleeves go past [[sleeves past fingers|her fingers]]. Her usual long hair has been tied up for a [[double bun]] look. She's seen holding a [[notebook]] and [[quill]], reading to jot down clues on the crime scene.

title: exterminator_(blame!)
body:
Exterminators are a subset of [[Safeguard (blame!)|]] that often appear as black and white [[humanoid robot]]s. They use primitive weaponry, often their [[claws]] or melee weapons, though stronger versions are capable of [[energy]] attacks.
They often attack in large numbers, similar to a horde of zombies. But also a handful can pose a serious threat to anyone without the Net Terminal Gene. This is because they possess a strong armor which can't be penetrated by normal weapons.
Most of the time the Exterminators bear the Safeguard -|- symbol on their [[forehead]].

title: real_world_location
body:
An image set in a known location in the real world.

The location could be a well-known building or landmark, or it could be an ordinary street or building with a known location.

The location should be depicted fairly accurately, so a fictionalized location with a well-known building or landmark in the background does not count. [[photo (medium)|Photos]] and [[photo background]]s also do not qualify.

Where known, please leave a comment providing some kind of location information (a Google maps link, latitude/longitude, etc). Famous buildings and landmarks should be given a tag.

h4. See also

* [[in-universe location]]
* [[Tag group:Real world locations]]

body:
Character from [[Muv-Luv]]. There are two versions of Mikoto, the female one in Unlimited and [[Muv-luv alternative|Alternative]]  and the male one in Extra. While the male and female versions of the character are almost physically identical, the kanji used for their first names are different ([b]美琴[/b] for the female version and [b]尊人[/b] for the male version). Both versions of Mikoto have [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] with [[parted bangs]] and [[antenna hair]].

Mikoto is voiced by [[Lynn (voice actor)|]] in the [[muv-luv alternative (anime)|Alternative anime adaptation]] and succeeding works.

title: plap_plap_plap_get_pregnant_(meme)
body:
A copypasta [[Twitter]] trend in which users post an image of a character from a given fandom and repeatedly write the word "[[PLAP]]," an onomatopoeia for sex noises, followed by repeatedly writing "GET PREGNANT," expressing a desire to [[impregnation|impregnate]] the character.

"GET PREGNANT" is a rather literal translation of 孕め, common dialogue in eromanga. 

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme: Plap Plap Get Pregnant":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/plap-plap-get-pregnant]

title: toyotarou
body:
[b]Toyotaro[/b] (initially working under the name [b]Toyble[/b]) is the official artist of the manga version of [[Dragon Ball Super]]. He is [[Toriyama Akira|Akira Toriyama]]'s chosen successor. He was initially a doujin artist (prominently doing his own version of the infamous [[Dragon Ball AF]] parallel to [[youngjijii|Young Jijii]]'s version) before being hired by Shueisha to work on [[Dragon Ball Heroes|Dragon Ball Heroes: Victory Mission]]. From there, he did the manga adaptation for [[dragon ball z fukkatsu no f|Resurrection 'F']] and was later chosen for Super.

h4. External links:

* Dragon Ball Wiki: "Toyotaro":http://dragonball.wikia.com/wiki/Toyotar%C5%8D

title: warugaki_(sk-ii)
body:
Artist. Quite possibly the grand master of mixing cute, epic, and absurd all at once, with only [[imizu_(nitro_unknown)|Imizu-san]] rivaling him. "Beware the non-threatening ones" would be a general rule of thumb in his works.

Is friends with many prominent artists and others from the doujin scene. Probably the most iconic are [[Vegas_(akg)|]] and [[Ryuuichi (f dragon)|]], who often accompany him in his report mangas.  

Noteable as a fan of [[Touhou]] and [[Grappler Baki]], and as such often mixed them together in his works.

body:

He has [[short hair|short]], [[black hair]], [[grey eyes]], and wears a [[black suit|black]] [[business suit]] and [[black necktie|tie]]. He has a [[medical eyepatch]] over his right eye, and an [[id card]] on the left breast of his suit.

title: f.l.u.d.d.
body:
The "Flash Liquidizer Ultra Dousing Device", better known as F.L.U.D.D. or FLUDD and pronounced "flood", is a multipurpose water pack from [[Super Mario Sunshine]]. It was invented by [[Professor Elvin Gadd]] and is carried like a backpack. Since F.L.U.D.D. is able to converse with [[Mario]], it's believed to be equipped with some kind of artificial intelligence.  In Japanese it is just called a "pump" (ポンプ).

h4. External links

* Mario Wiki: "F.L.U.D.D.":[http://www.mariowiki.com/F.L.U.D.D.]

title: bodeo_m1889
body:
The [b]Bodeo Model 1889[/b] (Pistola a Rotazione, Sistema Bodeo, Modello 1889) was an Italian six-shot [[revolver]] named after the head of the Italian [[gun|firearm]] commission, Carlo Bodeo. Produced between 1889 and 1931, it served the Italian military during the Two World Wars.

The [[weapon]] is characterized by its foldable trigger guard, collared ejector rod, and most models have hexagonal or octagonal barrel.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]

h1. External links
* "IMFDb":https://www.imfdb.org/wiki/Bodeo_M1889
* "Wikipedia: Bodeo Model 1889":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bodeo_Model_1889

title: taking_shelter
body:
The act of going underneath something in order to protect oneself from bad weather, most often [[rain]] or [[snow]]. One could take shelter [[under bridge|under a bridge]], an [[awning]], a [[bus stop]], or a [[under tree|tree]], among other possible locations or objects.

Not to be confused with [[taking cover]], for when a character attempts to protect themselves from danger.

h4. See also

* [[improvised umbrella]]

title: k-50m
body:
The [b]K-50M[/b] was a North [[Vietnam]]ese modification of the [[PPSh-41]] [b][[submachine gun]][/b]. It was used by the "PAVN":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Army_of_Vietnam and [[Viet Cong|Việt Cộng]] during the [[Vietnam War]].
The [[gun]] features a retractable wire stock modelled after the [[MAT-49]] and an [[AK-47]] pistol grip. Chambered in 7.62×25mm [[cartridge]], the K-50M accepts both curved 35-round [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] and the 71-round [[drum magazine|drum one]].

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[PPS-43]]

h1. External links
* "ForgottenWeapons.com":https://www.forgottenweapons.com/north-vietnamese-k-50m-submachine-gun/
* "Gun Wiki":https://guns.fandom.com/wiki/K50M

The music video uses the [[lat model (mikumikudance)|LAT-model]] for Miku and features heavy use of colorful visual artifacts, both in the background and on Hatsune Miku's outfit; and 3D wire frame renderings/meshes symbolizing connections.

title: ask_victor_more_(racehorse)
body:
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Kartica, he was the last of Deep Impact's progeny to win a classic race in Japan, being the winner of the 2022 Kikuka Sho.

He was a bay horse with a stripe and snip as well as socks on every leg.

He turned out to be a typical Deep Impact early bloomer as he went into a slump after the Kikuka Sho. Whether he could have broken out of his slump became a moot point after he unexpectedly died of heat stroke on August 8th 2023.

title: shadow_android
body:
A copy of [[Shadow the Hedgehog]] mass-produced by [[Dr. Eggman]]. Appear primarily in [[Sonic Heroes]] and [[shadow_the_hedgehog_(game)|Shadow's self-titled game]].

They can appear in different designs:
* Nearly identical duplicates the original Shadow
* Black fur, with other colors replacing Shadow's crimson stripes
* Grey bodies with stripes of other colors, along with [[black sclera]] and [[red eyes]]

External links
* "Sonic Retro: Shadow Android":https://info.sonicretro.org/Shadow_Android
